One of the school districts in San Antonio did this earlier in the year. They leased it to the Girl Scouts, who turned it into a scouting center. There were no specifics on what methods were used for the re-purposing, however any building modifications would have had some  "green" elements to them as that has been the direction the city has been taking in development. 
The article can be found here:
http://www.mysanantonio.com/news/education/article/Old-Edgewood-school-to-be-reborn-as-leadership-3581120.php

In Charlottesville, Jefferson School City Center is about to open. The historic African-American high school will include a wide range of health and education resources. We're excited about it: http://jeffersoncitycenter.com/city_center/overview.php. Another city school was converted into nonprofit art cooperative: http://mcguffeyartcenter.com/
Closer to you, Lansing has some good examples of school reuse by the private sector.

author: Eric Norenberg
text:
Our local school district is considering consolidating K-12 in one campus to be more cost effective and sustainable (with a carbon neutral goal).  This will leave three to four buildings/sites as surplus and the district would like to recoup some of the cost of the consolidated campus facility through the sale or lease of the surplus properties.  Three of the sites are in residential areas, and the fourth is adjacent to a state highway and a residential neighborhood.  
We are seeking examples of school districts that re-purposed and redeveloped an existing school facility and/or site in a way that has benefited the adjacent area, the community and the school district.  
In particular, school officials are interested in examples involving either of the following please:  

the old facility or site or was/is repurposed/redeveloped using ‘green’ construction methods for either a public purpose or private purpose following sale. 
the old facility was adaptively redeveloped into multi or single family housing involving a partnership between the school district and the developer.

Thanks!
title: School Building/Site Adaptive Reuse
